alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 11:08AM CDT until June 20 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Titus, Morris and Franklin Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Monday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 11.4 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 06/12/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
